item.title: Implementation of API Pagination
item.description: Overview Stable pagination is not a silver bullet. Consider sites like Reddit and Hacker News. Their pagination is inherently unstable: items are sorted by a volatile ranking, frequently moving up and down the list over time. How do they deal with it? They don’t. Both sites frequently showcases how bad it can look by showing duplicate items as you advance pages. It’s not all that bad, because neither site subscribes to the infinite scrolling crowd (yet?
